definitions.definition: an introduction at the beginning of a book explaining its purpose, thanking people who helped the author, etc.:
examples: In his preface, the author says that he took eight years to write the book.

definitions.definition: an event that comes before something more important:
examples: We're hoping these talks could be a preface to peace.

definitions.definition: If you preface your words or actions with something else, you say or do this other thing first:
examples: Each work is prefaced by a descriptive note and concludes with an author's note.
